docs.lead_paragraph: In the so-called gig economy, ambiguity in the status of workers at on-demand companies like Munchery, Uber and Lyft has led to calls for the creation of a new kind of employment status.

headline.main: A Middle Ground Between Contract Worker and Employee
headline.print_headline: Employees, Contractors and Those in Between

docs.abstract: News Analysis; ambiguity exists in status of workers at on-demand firms like Munchery and Uber; tech executives and policy advocates want new type of worker status that would split difference between categories of contractor and regular employee.
docs.snippet: In the so-called gig economy, ambiguity in the status of workers at on-demand companies like Munchery, Uber and Lyft has led to calls for the creation of a new kind of employment status.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Dec. 11 about Syrian refugees arriving in Canada, The Associated Press relying on a pool report from Canadian Press misidentified the occupations ofk refugees Kevork Jamkossian as a gynecologist and Georgina Zires as a lab technician. Jamkossian is a blacksmith and Zires a sales clerk.
docs.snippet: In a story Dec. 11 about Syrian refugees arriving in Canada, The Associated Press relying on a pool report from Canadian Press misidentified the occupations ofk refugees Kevork Jamkossian as a gynecologist and Georgina Zires as a lab technician....

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House and top lawmakers are struggling to wrap up a year's worth of budget work and let Congress adjourn next week for 2015. At issue are a $1.1 trillion government-wide spending bill and a sprawling renewal of tax breaks for businesses and individuals that could cost hundreds of billions of dollars over the next decade.

headline.main: Highlights of End-Of-Session Spending, Tax Bills in Congress
headline.print_headline: Highlights of End-Of-Session Spending, Tax Bills in Congress

docs.lead_paragraph: The lone health insurance cooperative to make money last year on the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges is now losing millions and suspending individual enrollment for 2016.

headline.main: Lone Profitable ACA Insurance Co-op Losing Millions
headline.print_headline: Lone Profitable ACA Insurance Co-op Losing Millions

docs.snippet: The lone health insurance cooperative to make money last year on the Affordable Care Act's public insurance exchanges is now losing millions and suspending individual enrollment for 2016.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Police Department commissioner, flanked by police and firefighters, pushed Congress on Thursday to keep dollars flowing to a health program for first responders and others who got sick working in the rubble of the Sept. 11 attacks.

headline.main: New York's Police Commissioner Fights for 9/11 Health Bill
headline.print_headline: New York's Police Commissioner Fights for 9/11 Health Bill

docs.snippet: The New York Police Department commissioner, flanked by police and firefighters, pushed Congress on Thursday to keep dollars flowing to a health program for first responders and others who got sick working in the rubble of the Sept. 11 attacks.

docs.lead_paragraph: When health insurer Humana Inc reported worse-than-expected quarterly earnings in late 2014 – including a 21 percent drop in net income – it softened the blow by immediately telling investors it would make a $500 million share repurchase.

headline.main: Special Report: Buybacks Enrich the Bosses Even When Business Sags
headline.print_headline: Special Report: Buybacks Enrich the Bosses Even When Business Sags

docs.snippet: When health insurer Humana Inc reported worse-than-expected quarterly earnings in late 2014 – including a 21 percent drop in net income – it softened the blow by immediately telling investors it would make a $500 million share repurchase.

docs.lead_paragraph: Creating a pan-European retail market in car insurance and pensions largely hinges on whether 500 million consumers will go online to widen their choice of products, the EU's executive body said on Thursday.

headline.main: EU Looks to Coax Consumers Online to Build Cross-Border Financial Market
headline.print_headline: EU Looks to Coax Consumers Online to Build Cross-Border Financial Market

docs.snippet: Creating a pan-European retail market in car insurance and pensions largely hinges on whether 500 million consumers will go online to widen their choice of products, the EU's executive body said on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: China will give household registration permits to its  unregistered citizens and make medical insurance coverage more equal, the government said on Wednesday, as it looks to overhaul systems often under fire for failing those people most in need.

headline.main: China to Grant Residence Rights to 13 Million Unregistered Citizens
headline.print_headline: China to Grant Residence Rights to 13 Million Unregistered Citizens

docs.snippet: China will give household registration permits to its  unregistered citizens and make medical insurance coverage more equal, the government said on Wednesday, as it looks to overhaul systems often under fire for failing those people most in need.
